Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the lymphoblastoid cell line derived from the patient's blood samples.

Readout description.Result Description: The mutant allele (p.Ala53Thr) was completely silenced in the patient's lymphoblastoid cell line.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was performed using lymphoblastoid cell lines from the patient and multiple controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in multiple replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantitative RT-PCR results were analyzed using Bio-gene V.97 software program.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: SNCA mRNA levels ranging from 65.1% to 86.2% of the mRNA of the patient.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: SNCA mRNA levels outside the range of 65.1% to 86.2% of the mRNA of the patient.

Material used.Description: Southern blot analysis was conducted on the lymphoblastoid cell line to investigate possible recombinational events.

Readout description.Result Description: No difference was found compared to the control DNA.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was performed using lymphoblastoid cell lines from the patient and multiple controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in multiple replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Visual inspection and comparison with control DNA.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No visible difference in band patterns.

Material used.Description: Cells were treated with 5-azadeoxycytidine (5-azadC), 4-phenylbutyrate (4-PBA), and trichostatin A (TSA) to investigate epigenetic silencing.

Readout description.Result Description: The silenced allele was reactivated by treatment with 4-PBA and TSA, indicating epigenetic silencing.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was performed using lymphoblastoid cell lines from the patient and multiple controls.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in multiple replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Visual inspection and comparison with control DNA.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No reactivation of the silenced allele.
